title: Trump Demands That Bondi Move ‘Now’ to Prosecute Foes
summary: His demand came a day after he ousted the federal prosecutor who failed to charge two of his most-reviled adversaries, Letitia James and James B. Comey.

title: Trump Justice Dept. Closed Investigation Into Tom Homan for Accepting Bag of Cash
summary: Mr. Homan came under scrutiny after he was said to be recorded last year taking $50,000 in cash from undercover F.B.I. agents.

title: California Bars ICE Agents From Wearing Masks in the State
summary: Gov. Gavin Newsom signed a bill to prevent federal agents from concealing their identities with masks. The law is expected to face a legal challenge.

title: Top Democratic Leaders Ask Trump for Meeting to Avert a Shutdown
summary: After a Republican plan to keep funding flowing foundered in the Senate, Representative Hakeem Jeffries and Senator Chuck Schumer accused the president of standing in the way of a solution.

title: With Calls for Retribution Over Kirk, Some See Rise of a ‘Woke Right’
summary: Conservatives have pressed for consequences for those who make negative comments about Charlie Kirk. But a few on the right say they worry about limits on speech.

title: Trump Escalates Attack on Free Speech
summary: Zolan Kanno-Youngs, a White House correspondent for The New York Times, describes how the Trump administration’s pressuring of ABC to take action against Jimmy Kimmel is part of a broader crackdown by the administration since the assassination of Charlie Kirk.

title: Arrest in Arizona Before Charlie Kirk Memorial Heightens Security Concerns
summary: After a man was charged with impersonating a police officer, a spokesman for the group Charlie Kirk founded said the man had been providing advance security for a guest.

title: He Wrote a Biting Post About Charlie Kirk. The Fury Came Fast.
summary: Residents of Palmetto Bay, Fla., have demanded the resignation of Councilman Stephen Cody, who wrote a post mocking Charlie Kirk’s support for gun rights.

title: What to Know About Charlie Kirk’s Funeral: Time, How to Watch and Speakers
summary: The conservative activist will be honored in a public program on Sunday, with President Trump and several top administration officials expected to speak.

title: Trump’s $100,000 H1-B Visa Fee Spurs Confusion and Chaos for Companies
summary: The White House sought to clarify the proclamation on Saturday, but many companies remained cautious. “We are still flying in somewhat foggy conditions,” one attorney said.

title: White House Outlines a TikTok Deal With a U.S. Board
summary: A potential deal to reduce TikTok’s ties to China would give the app a new board with six American directors out of seven, the White House press secretary said.

title: Trump Hails Progress on TikTok Deal After Call With Xi
summary: President Trump said he would meet with President Xi Jinping next month in South Korea. Mr. Xi said he welcomes a TikTok deal that would benefit both sides.

title: Seeing Through the Reality of Meta’s Smart Glasses
summary: Mark Zuckerberg’s glitch-filled unveiling of computerized glasses revealed a company that may struggle to deliver on its promise for the future of computing.

title: What Wall Street Sees in the Data Center Boom
summary: Data center capacity has become a barometer for both the health of the tech market and the risk of an A.I. bubble.

title: Can France’s Palestinian Proposal Change 75 Years of Failed Diplomacy?
summary: The French president has rallied 142 nations behind a road map for a two-state solution after the Gaza war ends. Missing from the list: Israel and the United States.

title: What to Know About the Visa Standoff Between Trump and the United Nations
summary: The president of the Palestinian Authority won’t be able to attend the U.N. General Assembly after the Trump administration denied him a visa.

title: They Helped Oust a Dictator. Now the New Regime Is Coming for Them.
summary: President Daniel Ortega of Nicaragua and his wife, who is co-president, have been arresting longtime loyalists, in an apparent quest to ensure no one outside the family rises to power.

title: They Were Promised a Taste of America. They Got Abuse and Exploitation.
summary: Every year, tens of thousands of young people are sent on visas to toil as farmworkers, housekeepers and office interns, all in the name of cultural exchange.

title: 4 Takeaways From the Times Investigation Into the J-1 Visa Program
summary: Some American companies have used the cultural exchange program as a supply of cheap, exploitable labor, records and interviews show.

title: Marian Burros, 92, Dies; Food Writer Famed for Her Plum Torte and More
summary: At The Times and elsewhere, she combined recipe writing with reporting on topics like consumer protection and food safety. Her torte was a longtime fan favorite.

title: Combs Sentencing Focuses Attention on Prostitution Law From 1910
summary: Acquitted of more serious charges, Sean Combs was found guilty of violating a law enacted during a panic over “white slavery” that is now a common tool in sex crimes prosecutions.

title: Robert Redford Was Everything You Hoped He’d Be
summary: Redford and Newman, real movie stars with real values.

title: Confused About Vaccine Guidance? Doctors Are, Too.
summary: Physicians are having tough conversations about vaccines.

title: Man Charged After Drive-by Shooting at Local ABC Station in Sacramento
summary: Officers responding to the site of the shooting found that at least three rounds had hit the station’s window. No injuries were reported, and a motive was unclear.

title: Five-Alarm Fire on Brooklyn Waterfront Devastates Artists’ Warehouse
summary: A row of converted 19th-century buildings filled with artists in the 1990s and transformed Red Hook. Now the work of more than 500 artists may be lost.

title: Diane Martel, Inventive Director of Music Videos, Dies at 63
summary: Over three decades, she worked with superstars such as Jennifer Lopez and Mariah Carey, and faced claims of misogyny with her video for Robin Thicke’s “Blurred Lines.”

title: Why Russia Revived a Cold War-Era Song Contest
summary: A Vietnamese pop star won the Intervision Song Contest in Moscow on Saturday. The United States was meant to participate, but politics intervened.
